intro: Mercurialis perennis var. ovata, commonly known as the broadleaf mercury plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in cymes, which are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and wetland restoration projects.
